title: 'Salford is one of the biggest underdog stories you'll ever see' - emotional Red Devils prepare to storm Old Trafford
text:
Talk to anyone about Salford Red Devils’ dramatic rise this season and the soundbites are always the same: “A bunch of grafters who fight for each other ... Ian Watson has done a remarkable job … how far can they actually go?”

Well, heading into their maiden Grand Final on Saturday against a St Helens side who finished top by a record 16 points, the biggest story in Super League history beckons.

Head coach Watson has taken the unwanted and inexpensive, stirred in a little overseas spice, and blended his team into a well-balanced, highly-motivated force punching above their weight.

In terms of recruitment budget and resources, the contrast with aristocratic Saints could not be greater.

“We’re a small group, but we’re really committed to each other and have always said that if we were ever to achieve anything then we would have to roll our sleeves up and work harder than most other teams,” says Watson. "I research players carefully before I sign them and I like competitors rather than egotistical showboaters.

“Yes, we have players with talent but we’ve been successful this year because we’ve ran our blood to water. To now find ourselves in a Grand Final, I think Salford supporters probably feel like it's a bit of a dream. People talked about Leicester City winning the Premier League as a big story, but they had money and we haven't.
